description: This table enables you to report on medications ordered. This table should be used with ORDER_MED.

columns.name: ORDER_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the order record.

columns.name: ORIG_RX_DOSAGE
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication order dosage.

columns.name: ORIG_RX_QUANTITY
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication order quantity.

columns.name: ORIG_RX_REFILLS
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication refills.

columns.name: ORIG_RX_DIRECTIONS
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication directions.

columns.name: ORIG_RX_PRE_PROV_ID
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication order prescriber ID.

columns.name: ORIG_RX_COMMENTS
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication comments.

columns.name: PRESCRIP_EXP_DATE
columns.description: Contains the expiration date for the prescription.

columns.name: ORD_AUC
columns.description: Item to store the area under curve value for medications using this value in dose calculation.

columns.name: ORD_SEL_TARGETAUC_C_NAME
columns.description:
Selected type of the Target AUC in the order composer.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Treatment Plan Target AUC


Order-Specific Target AUC

columns.name: ORIG_RX_PHRM_ID
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the pharmacy

columns.name: ORD_PHASE_OF_CARE_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item will store the phase of care for which this order was created. Example: Pre-Op, Intra-Op, PACU.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: ORIGINAL_MED_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the medication that determines the formulary status of the order at order entry. The formulary status of this medication at the time of ordering is found in the column ORDER_MED.NON_FORMULARY_YN. For Intelligent Medication Selection (IMS) cases, it will be the medication picked by the user before IMS changes the medication. This is only set for inpatient medication orders.  It is recommended to use the Clarity column ORDER_MEDINFO.DISPENSABLE_MED_ID when reporting on medication orders. Use ORIGINAL_MED_ID for reporting on the formulary status of medications chosen by ordering users.

columns.name: INTERACT_COMMENT
columns.description: Interaction override comment.

columns.name: COPY_POINTER_ID
columns.description: This object tracks order (ORD) record links created when using the inpatient or ambulatory order mover utilities to move an ORD record. This item is populated on the source ORD record and points to the target ORD record(s) created.

columns.name: CONDITION_FLAG
columns.description: This column contains the Condition Flag for an order.

columns.name: PRINT_LOCAL_COPY_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether to print a copy of this order. 'Y' indicates to print a copy of this order.  'N' indicates not to print a copy of this order.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: ORX_ID
columns.description: This column contains the record ID from the Order Lookup Index (ORX).  The ORX contains records for all active medication records and procedure records. This may be populated if an order originates from an Order Panel.

columns.name: ORX_ID_ORDER_LOOKUP_NAME
columns.description: The name (.2 item) for the order panel record.

columns.name: SELECTED_FOR_OPC_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the order has been selected for resulting in the Orderable/Performable/Chargeable navigator.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: MEDS_RESYME_REASO_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item stores the reason to resume the medication.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: MEDS_DC_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item is populated in discharge navigator to save discontinue reason at the time of discharge. The value entered will be copied to I ORD 7074.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: IP_INCLUDE_NOW_C_NAME
columns.description:
This is when to start the medication administration.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Include Now


As Scheduled


At Nurse Discretion

columns.name: IP_INCL_NOW_SCH_C_NAME
columns.description:
Result of Scheduling Include Now Instant for Order


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No Include Now Instant


Distinct Include Now Instant


Standard Time Matches Include Now Instant

columns.name: LAST_SCHED_DATE
columns.description: The last scheduled date of the order.

columns.name: MEDS_ACTION_VERB_C_NAME
columns.description:
Action verb which is used in patient sig of the order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 No Entries Defined

columns.name: MED_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Source of externally ordered medication.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 No Entries Defined

columns.name: CRCL_FORMULA_ID
columns.description: The creatinine clearance  CrCl programming point that will be used for AUC calculations for order whose dose calculation programming point does not specify a CrCl programming point.

columns.name: CRCL_FORMULA_ID_LPP_NAME
columns.description: The name of the extension.

columns.name: AFTER_ORDER_ID
columns.description: This column contains the After Order ID for an order.

columns.name: BEFORE_ORDER_ID
columns.description: This column contains the Before Order ID for an order.

columns.name: DIET_COMMENTS
columns.description: This column contains the Diet Comments entered for an order.

columns.name: END_DT_BEF_FILL_DT
columns.description: Stores the order's end date before it was changed due to the order being (re)filled. This is needed so that if the fills are ever cancelled, we know what to set the end date back to.

columns.name: PREV_POC_C_NAME
columns.description:
This column contains the previous phase of care (I ORD 61040). The phase of care for an order is stored in I ORD 61010.  If the phase of care is not needed when the sign and held order is released, the phase of care stored in I ORD 61010 is moved to I ORD 61040 for tracking purposes. The phase of care stored in I ORD 61040 can still be used in the MAR activity to allow for continued phase of care grouping.  The list of phases of care not needed when sign and held orders are released is stored in I LSD 61050.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: ORD_PHASE_OF_CARE_C_NAME

columns.name: ORDER_TIME
columns.description: The date and time when the medication order was placed.

columns.name: IS_HELD_ORDER_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item stores 1 if the order is signed and held and active


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes

columns.name: TXT_ORDPROV_NAME
columns.description: The name of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.

columns.name: TXT_ORDPROV_DEA
columns.description: The DEA number of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file. A DEA number is given to providers by the Drug Enforcement Administration and allows them to prescribe controlled substances.

columns.name: TXT_ORDPROV_NPI
columns.description: The National Provider Identifier (NPI) of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.

columns.name: TXT_ORDPROV_PHONE
columns.description: The phone number of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.

columns.name: TXT_ORDPROV_FAX
columns.description: The fax number of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.

columns.name: TXT_ORDPROV_STREET
columns.description: The street address of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.

columns.name: TXT_ORDPROV_CITY
columns.description: The city of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.

columns.name: TXT_ORDPROV_STATE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The state of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: TXT_ORDPROV_ZIP
columns.description: The zip code of the ordering provider, for providers that do not yet exist in the Provider (SER) master file.

columns.name: RX_SERIAL_NUMBER
columns.description: Stores the prescription serial number commonly found on triplicate prescription forms. Triplicate prescription forms are used for controlled substances and require multiple copies of the prescription form.

columns.name: NOCHRG_EXT_RSLT_YN
columns.description:
This column returns whether the order is an external result that should not drop charges. A value of 1 returns Y. A value of 0 returns N. A null value will return null but is treated the same as 0 when dropping charges.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: WT_MAX_DOSE
columns.description: This column returns the saved weight-based or body surface area (BSA)-based maximum dose for the order (ORD).

columns.name: WT_MAX_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description:
This column returns the saved unit for the weight-based or body surface area (BSA)-based maximum dose for the order (ORD).


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: MAX_DOSE_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description:
This column returns the source of max dose information that was used in the order (ORD).


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Preference List


Order Set


Treatment Plan Protocol


Medication


Order Panel or Group


Other


Dose Rule


Similar Order

columns.name: SRC_RX_MED_ID
columns.description: The ID of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.

columns.name: SRC_RX_QUANTITY
columns.description: The quantity of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.

columns.name: SRC_RX_DIS_DISP_QTY
columns.description: The discrete dispense quantity of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.

columns.name: SRC_RX_DISP_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description:
The discrete dispense unit of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: WT_MAX_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME

columns.name: SRC_RX_REFILLS
columns.description: The number of refills of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.

columns.name: SRC_RX_DIRECTIONS
columns.description: The directions (patient sig) of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.

columns.name: SRC_RX_START_DATE
columns.description: The start date of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.

columns.name: SRC_RX_END_DATE
columns.description: The end date of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.

columns.name: SRC_RX_DAW_YN
columns.description:
The Dispense as Written (DAW) flag of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: SELECTED_FOR_OPC_YN

columns.name: SRC_RX_PRES_PROV_ID
columns.description: The ID of the prescribing provider of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.

columns.name: SRC_RX_COMMENTS
columns.description: The comments associated with the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.

columns.name: PAT_SIG_REPLY_C_NAME
columns.description:
This column contains the user's response to the sig-related questions for previous sig reorder workflows. The sig is the description of how a medication is supposed to be administered which includes the dose and frequency.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes, use this sig


No, don't use this sig


Acknowledge can't use freetext sig.


Use discrete sig


Use freetext sig


Reported Sig - No Response


Use Prescribed Sig


Use Patient Reported Sig


Reported Sig - Use Other


Use Alternative Defaults


Multi-Product IMS Reorder - No Response


Multi-Product IMS Reorder - Individual


Multi-Product IMS Reorder - Overall


Reported Sig - Defer to Prescriber


Reported Sig - Take as Needed


Reported Sig - Restart Taking

columns.name: SIG_REVIEW_USER_ID
columns.description: Holds the user ID of the user who reviewed the patient sig for accuracy. The sig is the description of how a medication is supposed to be administered which includes the dose and frequency.

columns.name: SIG_REVIEW_INS_DTTM
columns.description: Holds the instant that the user took action on the patient sig in previous sig workflows. The sig is the description of how a medication is supposed to be administered which includes the dose and frequency.

columns.name: SRC_RX_WRITTEN_DATE
columns.description: The written date of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.

columns.name: DOSE_RND_ACK_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the acknowledgement reason given by the user to override a dose rounding warning on this order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: SRC_RX_DESC
columns.description: The description of the originally prescribed medication as returned by the pharmacy in a refill request.

columns.name: EPRES_DEST_C_NAME
columns.description:
Indicates the destination of e-prescribing order. It will be set by an interface or the ambulatory pharmacy system. The item may not be populated for the old order records.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Outgoing Interface


Willow Ambulatory

columns.name: CTRL_MED_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the medication was controlled when the order was signed.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NOCHRG_EXT_RSLT_YN
